description: three-tiered circular tower with movable flag at top on a circular footed stem base; the bottom tier has a door with latch; the walls of all tiers done in openwork filigree
provenance: (William Gross, Tel Aviv, Israel); Purchased by the MIA in 2000.
text: This tower shape is typical of the spice boxes used by Ashkenazi Jews (those of Germany, northern France, and eastern Europe). Documented as early as the 16th century, this shape remains popular today.
title: Spice Tower
